sen.j: 村上義光（むらかみ よしてる、生年不詳 - 元弘3年/正慶2年2月1日 (旧暦)（1333年4月15日））は鎌倉時代後期の武将。
sen.e: Yoshiteru MURAKAMI (year of birth unknown - April 15, 1333) was a Japanese military commander in the late Kamakura period.
Yoshiteru MURAKAMI (year of birth unknown - April 15, 1333) was a Japanese military commander in the late Kamakura period.
Yoshiteru MURAKAMI (year of birth unknown - April 15, 1333) was a Japanese military commander in the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: 通称、彦四郎。
sen.e: His common name was Hikoshiro.
His common name was Hikoshiro.
His common name was Hikoshiro.

sen.j: 村上信泰の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Nobuyasu MURAKAMI.
He was a son of Nobuyasu MURAKAMI.
He was a son of Nobuyasu MURAKAMI.

sen.j: 大塔宮護良親王の忠臣として知られる。
sen.e: He was known as a loyal subject of Imperial Prince Otonomiya Moriyoshi.
He was known as a loyal subject of Imperial Prince Otonomiya Moriyoshi.
He was known as a loyal subject of Imperial Prince Otonomiya Moriyoshi.

sen.j: 『太平記』によると元弘の変の後、奈良の般若寺から熊野へ逃れる護良親王に従う。
sen.e: According to "Taiheiki" (The Record of Great Peace), after the Genko Incident, he followed Imperial Prince Moriyoshi, who left the Hannya-ji Temple in Nara to Kumano.
According to "Taiheiki" (The Record of Great Peace), he served Imperial Prince Moriyoshi who fled the Hannya-ji Temple in Nara to Kumano, after the Genko Incident.
sen.cmt: 語順を変え、「従う」および「逃れる」の訳を書き直しました。
sen.e: According to "Taiheiki" (The Record of Great Peace), he served Imperial Prince Moriyoshi who fled the Hannya-ji Temple in Nara to Kumano, after the Genko Incident.

sen.j: 道中、敵方の土豪芋瀬庄司に遭遇し、親王一行はその通行を乞う。
sen.e: Along the way, as Imperial Prince and his subjects encountered Shoji IMOSE, the enemy of a local clan, they begged him to pass through.
Along the way, Imperial Prince and his subjects encountered Shoji IMOSE from a local clan which served their enemy, and they begged him to pass them through.
sen.cmt: 「敵方の土豪」の部分等、書き直しました。
sen.e: Along the way, Imperial Prince and his subjects encountered Shoji IMOSE from a local clan which served their enemy, and they begged him to pass them through.

sen.j: その際、芋瀬庄司は「幕府へ面子を立てる為、通すかわりに名のある臣を一人二人寄越せ」と返答してきた。
sen.e: Then Shoji IMOSE replied, "To do my duty to the shogunate, offer me one or two distinguished subjects instead of allowing you to pass."
Then Shoji IMOSE replied, 'Give me one or two distinguished subjects instead of allowing you to pass, so I can do my duty to the shogunate.'
sen.cmt: 「」を’’に直し、語順を変えました。
sen.e: Then Shoji IMOSE replied, 'Give me one or two distinguished subjects instead of allowing you to pass, so I can do my duty to the shogunate.'

sen.j: 赤松則祐（あかまつそくゆう）が親王の御為と名乗り出る。
sen.e: Sokuyu AKAMATSU volunteered for it to the benefit of Imperial Prince.
Sokuyu AKAMATSU stepped forward for the Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: 簡潔に書き変えました。
sen.e: Sokuyu AKAMATSU stepped forward for the Imperial Prince.

sen.j: 「主君の危機に臨んでは自らの命を投げ出す、これこそが臣下の道。」
sen.e: "In the crisis of the lord, I should sacrifice my life; this is what a proper subject is supposed to do.
Scrificing one's life in an emergency of his master; this is what a proper subject is supposed to do.'
sen.cmt: 原文に、一文となるように「」をつけ、訳文の"を ' にし、簡潔に書き変えました。
sen.e: Scrificing one's life in an emergency of his master; this is what a proper subject is supposed to do.'

sen.j: 「殿下の為に、この則祐、敵の手に渡ったかてかまわない。」
sen.e: It doesn't matter if I, Sokuyu, am passed into the hands of the enemy for the sake of Imperial Prince."
I, Sokuyu, wouldn't care if I were to passed into the hands of enemy for the Imperial Prince.'
sen.cmt: 原文に、一文となるように「をつけ、会話調にし、後列の」をひとつにまとめ、’にしました。
sen.e: I, Sokuyu, wouldn't care if I were to passed into the hands of enemy for the Imperial Prince.'

sen.j: しかし平賀三郎が、次のように提案した。
sen.e: However, Saburo HIRAGA suggested, "Not a single competent subject can be spared now for the sake of Imperial Prince.
However, Saburo HIRAGA suggested as follows:
sen.cmt: 原文に「次のように提案した。」と加えました。「」の部分は別に分けました。
sen.e: However, Saburo HIRAGA suggested as follows:

sen.j: 「宮の御為にも今は有能な武将は一人たりと失ってはいけない。」
sen.e: Not a single competent subject can be missed now for the sake of the Imperial Highness.'
Not a single competent subject can be missed now for the sake of the Imperial Highness.'

sen.j: 「御旗を渡して激闘の末逃げ延びた事にすれば芋瀬庄司の立場も守れる。」
sen.e: If we pretend that we relinquished the Imperial standard and escaped safely after a fierce fight, we can save Shoji IMOSE's face as well."
If we pretend that we relinquished the Imperial standard and escaped safely after a fierce fight, we can save Shoji IMOSE's face as well.'
sen.cmt: 一文となるように「」をつけ、「」を ' にしました。
sen.e: If we pretend that we relinquished the Imperial standard and escaped safely after a fierce fight, we can save Shoji IMOSE's face as well.'

sen.j: これを聞き入れて、大事な錦の御旗を芋瀬庄司に下して、何とか難所を乗り越えた。
sen.e: Accepting his suggestion, they relinquished their valuable Imperial standard to Shoji IMOSE and managed to overcome this difficult situation.
Accepting his suggestion, they relinquished their valuable Imperial standard to Shoji IMOSE and managed to overcome this difficult situation.
Accepting his suggestion, they relinquished their valuable Imperial standard to Shoji IMOSE and managed to overcome this difficult situation.

sen.j: 遅れて義光も芋瀬庄司に出くわすが、そこには錦の御旗が翻っていた。
sen.e: Belatedly, Yoshiteru also encountered Shoji IMOSE and found the Imperial standard flying there.
Belatedly, Yoshiteru also encountered Shoji IMOSE and found the Imperial standard flying there.
Belatedly, Yoshiteru also encountered Shoji IMOSE and found the Imperial standard flying there.

sen.j: 義光は激昂し、「帝の御子に対して、貴様ごときがなんということを！」といった。
sen.e: Yoshiteru got very angry, saying, "To His Imperial Highness Prince Moriyoshi, what a foolish thing you have done, you son of a bitch!"
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yoshiteru got very angry and said, 'How dare someone like you have done such things to the Imperial Prince !'
sen.cmt: you son of a bitch!は、不適切だと思ったので、書き換えました。「」を ' にしました。
sen.e: Yoshiteru got very angry and said, 'How dare someone like you have done such things to the Imperial Prince !'

sen.j: そして敵方に奪われた錦の御旗を取り返すという活躍をしている。
sen.e: He was brave enough to retrieve the Imperial standard taken by the enemy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: And he succeeded to retrieve the Imperial standard.
sen.cmt: Andを加え、「取り返すことに成功した」と解釈しました。
sen.e: And he succeeded to retrieve the Imperial standard.

sen.j: 吉野山が二階堂貞藤の大軍に攻められ陥落する際、護良親王を逃すため、「天照太神御子孫、神武天王より九十五代の帝、後醍醐天皇第二の皇子一品兵部卿親王尊仁、逆臣の為に亡され、恨を泉下に報ぜん為に、只今自害する有様見置て、汝等が武運忽に尽て、腹をきらんずる時の手本にせよ」と叫んだ。
sen.e: When Mt. Yoshino was fallen by Sadafuji NIKAIDO's massive force, to let Imperial Prince Moriyoshi escape safely, he shouted, "I am the descendant of Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess), Ippon Hyobukyo (Imperial Prince of the first rank, Minister for Military Affairs), Imperial Prince Moriyoshi, the second son of Emperor Godaigo who was the 95th generation from Emperor Jinmu. Now that I am overthrown by rebellious subjects, I settle my grudge by killing myself. Look how I am going to kill myself, and follow what I've done when you have to commit seppuku after using up your fortune of war."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「親王尊仁」は、身代わりになるわけですから、「親王護良」の間違いではないでしょうか 「恨を泉下に報ぜん為」は「死んで恨みを晴らす」と訳出しました
sen.e: When Mt. Yoshino was fallen by Sadafuji NIKAIDO's massive force, he shouted in order to let the Imperial Prince Moriyoshi escape safely, 'I am Ippon Hyobukyo (Imperial Prince of the first rank, Minister for Military Affairs), Imperial Prince Moriyoshi, the second son of Emperor Godaigo who was the 95th generation from Emperor Jinmu, the descendant of Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess). Look at how I am going to kill myself now in order not to be overthrown by rebellious subjects and settle my grudge in the afterworld, and follow what I've done when you have to commit seppuku after using up your fortune of war.'
sen.cmt: 天照太神御子孫は神武天王とし、後醍醐天皇を形容するものと解釈しました。「」を ' にしました。一原文一訳文の例外対処のため、原文の語尾を加え、文を。で終わらせました。
sen.e: When Mt. Yoshino was fallen by Sadafuji NIKAIDO's massive force, he shouted in order to let the Imperial Prince Moriyoshi escape safely, 'I am Ippon Hyobukyo (Imperial Prince of the first rank, Minister for Military Affairs), Imperial Prince Moriyoshi, the second son of Emperor Godaigo who was the 95th generation from Emperor Jinmu, the descendant of Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess). Look at how I am going to kill myself now in order not to be overthrown by rebellious subjects and settle my grudge in the afterworld, and follow what I've done when you have to commit seppuku after using up your fortune of war.'

sen.j: 自ら親王であると偽り名乗り、身代わりとなって切腹して自刃した。
sen.e: Pretending and declaring himself to be Imperial Prince, he committed seppuku for his lord.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Arrogating himself to be Imperial Prince, he committed seppuku in place of him.
sen.cmt: 偽って名乗る部分をarrocateとしました。
sen.e: Arrogating himself to be Imperial Prince, he committed seppuku in place of him.

sen.j: なお、子の義隆も義光と共に死のうとしたが、義光はこれを止め、宮を守るよう言いつけた。
sen.e: On that occasion, his son, Yoshitaka, tried to kill himself; however, Yoshiteru stopped him from doing so and ordered him to protect Prince.
On that occasion, his son, Yoshitaka, tried to kill himself with Yoshiteru, but Yoshiteru stopped this and told him to protect the Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: 簡潔に書き直しました。
sen.e: On that occasion, his son, Yoshitaka, tried to kill himself with Yoshiteru, but Yoshiteru stopped this and told him to protect the Imperial Prince.

sen.j: その後、義隆は宮を落ち延びさせるため奮闘し、満身創痍となり力尽き、切腹し自害した。
sen.e: After that, Yoshitaka worked hard to let Imperial Prince escape safely, so that he had wounds all over his body, exhausted his energies, and committed seppuku to die.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After that, Yoshitaka worked hard to let Imperial Prince escape safely, but he was injured all over, exhausted, and committed seppuku.
sen.cmt: 簡潔に書き直しました。
sen.e: After that, Yoshitaka worked hard to let Imperial Prince escape safely, but he was injured all over, exhausted, and committed seppuku.

sen.j: （切腹しなお、自らのはらわたを引きちぎり、敵に投げつけたという、壮絶な逸話がある）。
sen.e: (There is a heroic anecdote about him that he pulled his gut off and threw it to the enemy even after committing seppuku.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (There is a heroic anecdote about him that he pulled his gut off and threw it to the enemy even after committing seppuku.)
